intro: Osteospermum grandiflorum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has silvery-green, hairy leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Osteospermum grandiflorum is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
